In the Security and Order section,
hundreds of unknown license plates were discovered at
printing establishments
and investigated the case of a car hitting a series of

ladies and gentlemen.  Many businesses that use printing
to make advertising signs or
motorbike toys have now produced and displayed
fake license plates. This is a
violation of the law and indirectly supports
illegal activities.  disrupting
social order and safety, making it difficult to
investigate and arrest criminals.
Ho Chi Minh City police opened an inspection of
these establishments and confiscated hundreds of
fake license plates on the first day of the
investigation teams.  The collaborators inspected 26
business establishments in many places displaying
license plates for cars and motorbikes of unknown origin
without the National Emblem, many of which
were printed with shapes and decals. The result was that
seven establishments could not present them.
Business registration licenses for 14 establishments violating
fire prevention and fighting regulations.
Authorities confiscated 277 license plates of
unknown origin, including 145 car license plates and
132 motorbike license plates. Documents and lost objects were
handed over.  for the Ward police to continue
